p: As human life spans are prolonged, the incidence of neurodegenerative diseases is increasing. PD is the second most common neurodegenerative diseases worldwide (after Alzheimer's disease) and is currently the most important known risk factor of the elderly with only symptomatic treatment [ 2, 3]. Therefore, insight into the mechanism of PD is essential. In this study, we contribute to the understanding of the putative roles of lncRNAs, which provide an additional level of gene expression regulation in the development of sporadic, polygenic PD.
